meanings.definition: The period of twilight at the beginning or end of the day.
meanings.sent1: During the crepuscule, the sky turns a beautiful shade of orange.
meanings.sent2: The crepuscule is a magical time when day transitions into night.
meanings.sent3: I always feel a sense of calm during the crepuscule.
meanings.sent4: The crepuscule painted the sky with hues of pink and purple.
meanings.sent5: The crepuscule's beauty never fails to captivate me.

meanings.definition: A dim or indistinct light or illumination.
meanings.sent1: In the crepuscule of the room, I could barely see anything.
meanings.sent2: The crepuscule of the candle flickered gently in the darkness.
meanings.sent3: The crepuscule from the nightlight cast eerie shadows on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The crepuscule of the distant stars guided us through the night.
meanings.sent5: The crepuscule of the moonlight created a mystical atmosphere.
